comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: AKA Myer Nussbaum; referee appointed to hear testimony in the state hearings about conspiracy among New York's wholesale bakeries. Myer Nussbaum was a lawyer and a state Senator representing Albany. www.jewishencyclopedia.com/articles/11634-nussbaum-myer

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: I didn't find any sources for "Meyer" as a correct spelling, so I think we have to write this off to a mistake by the Bain captioner. Nussbaum (a Republican who had also been a judge in Albany as well an Assemblyman before serving as state Senator 1895-8) was the first Jewish graduate (1877) of Albany Law School. issuu.com/albanylaw/docs/albany_law_diversity_bro_11_fina...

comment.author: 34997905@N03
comment._content: Thanks. We'll submit this for a correction to the catalog record for Myer Nussbaum.
